comments.content:
Could be [Combat](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009140935/http:/typophile.com/node/66618#comment-533925), bespoke typeface exclusive for Nike, some kind of stencil version of [Stratum 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009140935/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/processtype/stratum2).  
Ready-to-go alternatives: [Amiral 205](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009140935/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gautier/amiral), [Vafle](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009140935/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/suitcase/vafle) Stencil  
To-be-"stencil(iz)ed": [Industry HFF](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009140935/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/industry), [Quarca Insigne](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009140935/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/insigne/quarca)
Yes, it's definitely Combat. Just wish I could get ahold of it! Thanks very much.

Notes, apparently by the designer of Combat:  
 [http://gus555.wordpress.com/2011/03/28/prepare-for-combat-the-font-famil...](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009140935/http:/gus555.wordpress.com/2011/03/28/prepare-for-combat-the-font-family-that-is/ "http://gus555.wordpress.com/2011/03/28/prepare-for-combat-the-font-family-that-is/")  
Stencil versions were produced in bold and black weights.  
This image shows where the cuts are placed in the stencil version of bold oblique.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009140935im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NikeCombatBoldOblique_5655.jpg)
  
Don
